param.name: Consideration of NH₄
param.dialogReference: Consider NH4 or not.

param.name: Source locations (point)
param.dialogReference: A point feature layer specifying the locations of the OSTDS.

param.name: Water bodies
param.dialogReference: Specifies the locations of water bodies. This layer serves to ensure that each plume terminates at the boundary of any water body. It is the same input as that used in the Particle Tracking module.

param.name: Particle paths
param.dialogReference: The particle paths corresponding to the Source locations, as calculated by the flow module. It is the output file of the particle tracking module. Using this file, the Transport module will calculate the average velocity (harmonic mean) and porosity (arithmetic mean) along each flow path. These values are then used for the calculation of each plume.

param.name: Output Plumes of NO₃
param.dialogReference: This is the name of output raster file of NO3 concentration. Either you can add a suffix indicating the raster format, or you can leave it out and use the default raster format of ArcGIS.

param.name: Output Plumes of NH₄
param.dialogReference: This is the name of output raster file of NH4 concentration. Either you can add a suffix indicating the raster format, or you can leave it out and use the default raster format of ArcGIS.

param.name: Output Plumes info of NO₃
param.dialogReference: An additional file, the “info” file, will be saved in the same disk location as the plumes raster, with the same name as the plumes raster having except having the “_info” suffix. The info file is a shapefile containing points corresponding to each source location. Each point has an associated set of attributes that describe the plume corresponding to that source (the parameters used to calculate the plume, the warping and post processing methods etc).

param.name: Output Plumes info of NH₄
param.dialogReference: An additional file, the “info” file, will be saved in the same disk location as the plumes raster, with the same name as the plumes raster having except having the “_info” suffix. The info file is a shapefile containing points corresponding to each source location. Each point has an associated set of attributes that describe the plume corresponding to that source (the parameters used to calculate the plume, the warping and post processing methods etc).

param.name: Solution type
param.dialogReference: The form of the Domenico solution to use.

param.name: Plume warping control point spacing
param.dialogReference: This parameter is used to warp the plume to specific flow paths. It specifies the number of cells along the plume centerline (starting from the source location) which separates the control points used for warping. The control point spacing, along with the plume length and the value of the Plume Cell Size determines the number of control points for any given plume.

param.name: Plume warping method
param.dialogReference: The warping algorithm to use.

param.name: Threshold Concentration
param.dialogReference: The threshold value below which the nitrate concentration will be considered zero.

param.name: Postprocessing
param.dialogReference: This setting controls how the plumes that intersect a water body are handled.

param.name: Demenico Bdy.
param.expression: Specified Input Mass Rate | Specified Z
param.dialogReference: Whether specified input mass rate or specified Z.

param.name: Mass input
param.dialogReference: If the value of the Domenico Bdy. parameter is set to Specified_Input_Mass_Rate, then this input will be enabled. The value of the Min parameter represents a known input mass rate, in units of mass per time, from the constant concentration source plane.

param.name: Source Dimension Y
param.dialogReference: The width Y (in map units) of the Domenico source plane.

param.name: Source Dimension Z
param.dialogReference: The depth Z (in map units) of the Domenico source plane. If specified input mass rate is chosen, Z will be calculated by the model based on mass input.

param.name: Maximum Z
param.dialogReference: Whether to limit the value of Z. In some extreme situations, when calculating Z based on the specified input mass rate, Z may result in very large value.

param.name: Zmax
param.dialogReference: The maximum Z value of the Domenico source plane when limiting the value of Z.

param.name: Plume cell size
param.dialogReference: The resolution of the grid (in map units) over which the Domenico solution will be evaluated. A smaller value will yield higher resolution plumes, at the expense of increased computation time and memory usage.

param.name: NO₃ Concentration
param.dialogReference: The NO3 concentration of the source plane. If the input source locations (shapefile) contains a column named no3_conc, then the value in the input file will be used. This allows you to enter different initial concentrations for different OSTDS. If not, the input value here will be used as the initial value for all OSTDS.

param.name: NO₃ Dispersivity αL
param.dialogReference: Longitudinal dispersivity for NO3.

param.name: NO₃ Dispersivity αTH
param.dialogReference: Horizontal dispersivities for NO3.

param.name: Denitrification Decay Rate
param.dialogReference: The first-order decay constant for NO3. This constant controls the amount of nitrate loss due to denitrification.

param.name: Volume Conversion Factor
param.dialogReference: This factor is used to convert volumes calculated from the units of length to the volume units used for concentration. For example, if the value of NO3 concentration was specified using the unit of mg/l, and the length units (units of the cell size, source dimensions, dispersivities, and length portion of the flow velocity magnitude units) are in meters, the conversion factor is 1000 since 1000 liters equals one cubic meter.

param.name: NH₄ Concentration
param.dialogReference: The NH4 concentration of the source plane. If the input source locations (shapefile) contains a column named nh4_conc, then the value in the input file will be used. This allows you to enter different initial concentrations for different OSTDS. If not, the input value here will be used as the initial value for all OSTDS.

param.name: NH₄ Dispersivity αL
param.dialogReference: Longitudinal dispersivity for NH4.

param.name: NH₄ Dispersivity αTH
param.dialogReference: Horizontal transverse dispersivity of NH4.

param.name: Nitrification Decay Rate
param.dialogReference: The first-order decay constant for NH4. This constant controls the amount of ammonium loss due to nitrification.

param.name: Bulk Density
param.dialogReference: Bulk density.

param.name: Adsorption coefficient
param.dialogReference: Adsorption coefficient for NH4.
